intro: Cryptocarya turbinata, commonly known as the Turbinated Cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Australia, specifically found in the southeastern regions of the country. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
